title: (x) Fremont Presbyterian Church - Schneidler Initials, Erazure {Marc O, Mike Y}
content:
Its not shango on the top..   
   
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/castletype/shango/regular/?PREFS\_SET%5BRenderSize%5D=36&PREFS\_SET%5BRenderString%5D=FREMONT](http://web.archive.org/web/20080430230323/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/castletype/shango/regular/?PREFS_SET%5BRenderSize%5D=36&PREFS_SET%5BRenderString%5D=FREMONT)   
   
and I have no idea where to start on the bottom ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080430230323im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/47865.jpg)

 [‹ Looking for a script face similar to "Peterbilt" logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20080430230323/http:/www.typophile.com/node/6449 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Swatch logo - custom designed {James} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080430230323/http:/www.typophile.com/node/6442 "Go to next forum topic")
author: amiart

comments.content:
The script face is Erazure from Panache (FontHaus). Here is the sample from the Script Font ID Guide, Part 11:   
 ![Erazure sample](http://web.archive.org/web/20080430230323im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/47868.gif)

_( If you are looking for a free alternate version, for the top one, you may want to take a closer look at ' [Backstabber Roman](http://web.archive.org/web/20080430230323/http:/www.core.nu/freefonts.html)', by [Martin Fredrikson](http://web.archive.org/web/20080430230323/http:/www.core.nu/).. )_

The serif used for FREMONT is probably the face that Shango is based on: Schneidler Initials.   
   
 [http://www.fonthaus.com/products/fonts/view.cfm?sku=FH100160](http://web.archive.org/web/20080430230323/http:/www.fonthaus.com/products/fonts/view.cfm?sku=FH100160)
